subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Ahhh the infamous Fish!
author: Lisby
full_text:
You're not the Bill from the AA-EVP list, are you?

Ann

On Aug 17, 2008, at 8:30 PM, black bear hollow wrote:

> Amen to that Ann. I've met more angels than devils for sure. lol!  
> I'm not convinced that having had an NDE was what caused Erland's,  
> my, and others sensitivity, but maybe. Some are just more sensitive  
> than others.  What was really interesting was that I was told that  
> I'm "very protected" and that's what stopped the events - which I  
> can't say were all that negative, just unexpected and very super  
> natural. Having a voice come through the air vents of you vehicle,  
> lights flashing, papers flying, and even having your mail man  
> report "something" said hello to him on our porch when we weren't  
> home, was very unnerving, but I can't say it was all bad. Just  
> incredibly weird.
>
>
> One funny thing to note about my experience... I got annoyed -  
> REALLY annoyed at their behavior and refused to speak to them. I  
> was doing laundry when the light above me began buzzing/flashing  
> and suddenly a voice came through and apologized for the trouble.
>
> I think of these things now and hardly believe them myself. They  
> just seem a bit too "Hollywood" for my taste. I'm glad I didn't  
> experience them alone and people that know me still talk about  
> things that happened today. It made very clear to me that this  
> world we experience in a body, isn't real. We're pretty limited in  
> what our mortal senses can perceive. Outside of this fleshy avatar  
> is so much more!
>
> w.
> On Aug 17, 2008, at 8:16 PM, Lisby wrote:
>
>> I would reason that since the majority of people experience such  
>> positive outcomes from an NDE--it is in the whole a positive  
>> experience for almost every person who has one--it would not  
>> provide the necessary negative energy for purportedly negative  
>> entities to feed off. In fact, the majority of NDEers are  
>> transformed in a very positive way indeed. Rarified, even. Seems  
>> like an odd food choice for the Fishes.
>
>
>
